entry.title: Ginza Line・銀座線
entry.content:
Slow exposure at the Shibuya Station of Tokyo’s Ginza Line subway. Shot on Ilford HP5 film.

東京の銀座線渋谷駅でのスローシャッター。イルフォード HP5フィルムで撮影。
entry.summary: Slow exposure at the Shibuya Station of Tokyo’s Ginza Line subway. Shot on Ilford HP5 film.

entry.title: Misty Morning・朝霧
entry.content:
Mist emanating from Atelier Yusai as I was walking by this morning. Maybe its another special effect like at Ninna-ji Temple this spring. Those are Yusai's hanging textiles.

今朝、通りかかった際にアトリエ祐斎から立ち上る霧。もしかしたら、今年の春に仁和寺で見たような特別な効果があるのかもしれない。吊るされたテキスタイルは祐斎氏によるもの。
entry.summary: Mist emanating from Atelier Yusai as I was walking by this morning. Maybe its another special effect like at Ninna-ji Temple this spring. Those are Yusai's hanging textiles.

entry.title: Ishibunebashi Bridge・石船橋
entry.content:
This picturesque footbridge is at a bend in the Minamiaki River, in Akigawa Valley at the extreme west end of Tokyo.

この絵のように美しい歩道橋は、東京の最西端にある秋川渓谷の南秋川の曲がり角にある。
entry.summary: This picturesque footbridge is at a bend in the Minamiaki River, in Akigawa Valley at the extreme west end of Tokyo.

entry.title: Kurochaya・黒茶屋
entry.content:
This is just a restaurant customer waiting area, but the round window with the paper shoji screen, and the hanging jizaikagi with a fish (usually hanging over a hearth) creates a serene Japanese feeling.

Kurochaya is a Japanese restaurant in a 300 year old traditional home, along the Akigawa River in the western foothills of Tokyo, far from Tokyo Tower.

これは、ただのレストランの待合室の写真ですが、丸い窓に和紙の障子があり、魚が飾られた自在鉤が掛かっていることで、静かな和の雰囲気が感じられます。

黒茶屋は、東京タワーから遠く離れた東京の西の山麓、秋川沿いに位置する、300年の歴史を持つ古民家を利用した日本料理店です。
entry.summary: This is just a restaurant customer waiting area, but the round window with the paper shoji screen, and the hanging jizaikagi with a fish (usually hanging over a hearth) creates a serene Japanese feeling. Kurochaya is a Japanese restaurant in a 300 year old traditional home, along the Akigawa River in the western foothills of Tokyo, far from Tokyo Tower.

entry.title: Kyoto Prefectural Library・京都府立図書館

link.title: Kyoto Prefectural Library・京都府立図書館

entry.content:
The Kyoto Prefectural Library is one of many western style buildings built at the beginning of the 20th Century that still exist in Kyoto. Opened in 1909, the library sustained damage in the 1995 Hanshin (Kobe) Earthquake. It was completely rebuilt in 2000 while maintaining the original façade. The basement, shown in the lower half of this photo is completely new, and looks out onto a small subterranean garden.

京都府立図書館は、20世紀初頭に建てられた西洋風の建築物のひとつで、京都には今でも残っている。1909年に開館したこの図書館は、1995年の阪神淡路大震災で被害を受けた。2000年に全面的に再建され、元の外観はそのままに保たれた。この写真の下半分に写っている地下部分は完全に新しく、小さな庭に面している。
entry.summary: The Kyoto Prefectural Library is one of many western style buildings built at the beginning of the 20th Century that still exist in Kyoto. Opened in 1909, the library sustained damage in the 1995 Hanshin (Kobe) Earthquake. It was completely rebuilt in 2000 while maintaining the original façade. The basement, shown in the lower half of this photo is completely new, and looks out onto a small subterranean garden.

entry.title: Randen Garage・嵐電車庫
entry.content:
Some of the motley crew of streetcars used on the Keifuku Randen Line. I love the squiggly tracks to get the streetcars in and out of the garage.

京福嵐電線で使用されているさまざまな路面電車の一部。路面電車を車庫に出し入れするための曲がりくねった線路が大好きだ。
entry.summary: Some of the motley crew of streetcars used on the Keifuku Randen Line. I love the squiggly tracks to get the streetcars in and out of the garage.
